channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I’m a 25-year-old founder who loves robots but too many humanoids are militant and creepy-looking. Things need to change—just look at Elon Musk
item.description: Who’s raising our robots? Teaching social norms in the age of humanoid robots.

item.title: Trump is giving the U.S. economy a $65 billion tax-refund shot in the arm, mostly for higher-income people, BofA says
item.description: "The consumer divide is about to get deeper," BofA's senior U.S. economist Aditya Bhave wrote on Wednesday.

item.title: Trump officials quietly meet with Canadian separatist group
item.description: The Trump administration has been holding covert meetings with a fringe group seeking to separate the oil-rich province of Alberta from the rest of Ca...

item.title: The Egregious Haitian-Immigration Decision
item.description: A federal judge’s ruling blocking President Trump from ending Haiti’s protected status doesn’t pass the smell test.

item.title: Is Feminism Compatible With Christianity? Something Wicked Says Absolutely Not
item.description: Something Wicked asks us to take a step back and evaluate an ideology that pursues pure individual autonomy by trampling upon the lives of others.

item.title: OpenAI announces Frontier, an AI agent platform for enterprises to power apps like Salesforce and Workday—but could it eventually replace them?
item.description: OpenAI’s new enterprise platform lets companies build and manage agents that sit on top of existing software, blurring the line between partner and co...

item.title: Overreliance on Renewables Leaves Americans Out in the Cold
item.description: Americans are at greater risk of power outages when we rely too much on wind, solar, and battery storage systems.

item.title: Lawmakers escalate Epstein probe with possible Bill Gates subpoena
item.description: House Oversight Committee members are weighing a subpoena for Bill Gates as lawmakers work through 3.5 million newly released Jeffrey Epstein files.

item.title: The Government Food Pyramid Is All Junk
item.description: It’s the height of arrogance for bureaucrats to tell us what to eat.

item.title: Democrats reveal 10-point list of demands for ICE reforms
item.description: Democratic leaders laid out their terms for continuing to fund Homeland Security on Wednesday, saying the department must severely curb its immigratio...

item.title: Chinese national who exposed rights abuses is freed from U.S. detention after being granted asylum
item.description: Guan Heng, a Chinese national who exposed human rights abuses in his homeland, has been released from federal detention more than five months after be...

item.title: Options traders pile into tech hedges after software rout
item.description: “The question is how low do you go?” said Michael Bailey of FBB Capital Partners. “Investors hate software, that’s pretty clear.”

item.title: Trump Stops Tax Dollars From Funding Transgender Ideology In Other Countries
item.description: The State Department is ensuring that taxpayer dollars don’t fund trans ideology thinly disguised as 'global humanitarian assistance.'

item.title: Michael Lewis reveals he’s got a deal to write the Sam Altman book—when ChatGPT is ready to write a rival draft
item.description: Altman admitted over dinner that ChatGPT wasn't nearly advanced enough, Lewis claimed. "He said, it'd be a really bad book."

item.title: Where Ice and ICE Meet
item.description: On the south side of Minneapolis, getting rid of the ice has a different meaning.

item.title: In the Glass Hive of Art News: Dark Clouds at the Met, Boston’s MFA
item.description: New directors, federal arts money keeps flowing, and a young lion finds a new home.

item.title: Vice President J.D. Vance to represent U.S. at Winter Olympics opening ceremony
item.description: Vice President J.D. Vance on Friday will lead the American delegation to the opening ceremony of the 2026 Winter Olympics in Italy, accompanied by Hom...

item.title: WSJ’s Tulsi Gabbard Hoax Is Straight From The Russia-Collusion Playbook
item.description: The real story is not the supposed scandal. It is the relentless recycling of the same hoax playbook and the media’s grotesque complicity.

item.title: AOC spent over $53K in campaign funds on luxury hotels in 2025: 'Carpetbagger'
item.description: New campaign finance filings show AOC topped $53,000 in luxury and boutique hotel spending in 2025, drawing renewed scrutiny over how her travel tab m...

item.title: Nike faces federal probe over allegations of 'DEI-related' discrimination against white workers
item.description: The federal agency for protecting workers' civil rights revealed Wednesday that it is investigating sportswear giant Nike for allegedly discriminating...

item.title: Hating ‘Hate’ Is The Left’s Laziest And Dumbest Virtue-Signal Yet
item.description: 'Hate' is just another word for meanness, which is the opposite of niceness, which is the guiding ethic of the postmodern liberal mind.

item.title: Trump jokes why he can’t sleep on planes, sparking laughter during National Prayer Breakfast
item.description: President Donald Trump jokes about watching for "missiles and enemies" instead of sleeping on Air Force One, during his speech at the National Prayer ...

item.title: Socialist mayor Mamdani backs Hochul in move that could reshape New York governor race
item.description: Democratic socialist NYC Mayor Zohran Mamdani endorses moderate Gov. Kathy Hochul for re-election, bridging New York's progressive-centrist divide.

item.title: ‘Moderate’ Dems Take Big Checks From Billionaire Donor With Epstein Ties
item.description: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman has donated more than $1.8 million to the Welcome PAC, funding Dem campaigns in competitive House races.
